alert.note: Alert for Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 24 at 9:07PM CDT until September 24 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN MOTLEY AND NORTHWESTERN COTTLE COUNTIES... At 906 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles south of Cee Vee, or 10 miles northwest of Paducah, moving southeast at 30 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR WESTERN COTTLE COUNTY, WHICH INCLUDES THE TOWN OF PADUCAH. HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Paducah and Cee Vee. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
